newsitem.title: USA: Man arrested for defrauding Barclays.
newsitem.headline: Man arrested for defrauding Barclays.

text.p: An employee of M.D. Sass Investor Services has been arrested on charges he defrauded Barclays Bank, a unit of Barclays Plc of between $10 million and $11 million, federal prosecutors said on Wednesday.

Trevor Hunt, 31, is accused of falsely representing for the past two years that he was acting on behalf of Manhattan-based Sass when he instructed Barclays to wire the funds into a Sass profit-sharing account held for Sass by Bear, Stearns & Co.

The federal complaint against Hunt alleges he sent faxes to Bear Stearns directing the investment firm to transfer the funds received from Barclays to various bank accounts Hunt had opened under his and his brother's name as well as various corporations.
Hunt allegedly used a photocopied signature of Sass' chief financial officer on the faxes.
The complaint alleged he used the same method to remove an additional $1.5 million in Sass' assets.

Hunt used the money to buy about 30 cars, including a Porsche, a Lamberghini, a Jaguar and several Grand Prix racing cars. He also bought several homes, expensive clothing and electronic equipment, the compliant charged.
